Miscellaneous.description:
A binary file - `flag` - has been hidden in `image.png` via
[LSB-Steganography](https://youtu.be/TWEXCYQKyDc)! It is known
that `flag` is 11,392 bytes large. Also, the file is spread
across the first N pixels of the image when traversing in
[row-major order](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Row-_and_column-major_order).

Can you recover the executable and uncover the flag?
Miscellaneous.name: Smoke and Mirrors
Sanity Check

Miscellaneous.description:
Did you manage to log in?

> `nc challs1.nusgreyhats.org 5401`
Miscellaneous.name: Bash Injection

Miscellaneous.description:
There is a flag hidden in the discord channel, I wonder where it is?

Flag formats are in the form greyhats{...} unless otherwise stated

https://discord.gg/7gZj43jH
Miscellaneous.name: Reading the channel

Miscellaneous.description: We really appreciate your feedback https://forms.gle/6YVv75ttCL83vFtY8
Miscellaneous.name: Feedback

OSINT.description:
Now that we know the sender's username from Stalking 1. Can you help us to find the person's name and birthdate?

People usually release this information on their social media accounts.

Flag Format : greyhats{dd/mm/yyyy_FirstName_LastName}

- mechfrog88
OSINT.name: Stalking 2
Stalking 1

Pwn.description:
I wrote an hexdump converter service with my friend. He said that it looked very vulnerable, and volunteered to 'fix' it. I'm not quite sure he did ...

Connect via
> nc challs1.nusgreyhats.org 5002
---

P.S. If you are new to pwn, checkout the hints
hints: Try to make the program crash! Use gdb or other debuggers to see why it crashed

If jumping to `win` doesn't work, it's due to [this, extra reading!](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/54393105/libcs-system-when-the-stack-pointer-is-not-16-padded-causes-segmentation-faul) Try jumping to `win+5` instead :)
Pwn.name: hexdump-bof

Pwn.description:
I take away `system`, what can you do now?

> `nc challs1.nusgreyhats.org 5013`
Pwn.name: kidrop

Pwn.description:
Ah, I **love** menu driven 64-bit notepad programs, I can cram so much content into them! Including flaws ...

> nc challs1.nusgreyhats.org 5001
---
Pwn.name: Notepad--

Pwn.description:
You are ready for more return-oriented programming.

> `nc challs1.nusgreyhats.org 5012`
Pwn.name: babyrop

Pwn.description:
I made a program to check if a list of numbers is distinct by sorting them then iterating over them!
*Genius*, right?! Except the sort looks off ...

> nc challs1.nusgreyhats.org 5000
---
hints: Source code isn't everything. Use tools like Ghidra or IDA to see the memory layout
Learn to use a debugger like gdb. Use extensions to improve the pwning experience e.g. [pwndbg](https://github.com/pwndbg/pwndbg), [gef](https://gef.readthedocs.io/)
Pwn.name: Distinct

Pwn.description:
I heard `HashMaps` are `O(1)`, I made my own `HashMap` as a Service (HaaS), and I calculated the time complexity to be ... `O(pwn)`!?

> nc challs1.nusgreyhats.org 5005
---
hints: Read up on what shellcode is. This challenge requires knowledge of x86_64 Assembly and the usage of a debugger
Pwn.name: O(pwn)

Pwn.description:
